title: Ukraine Raids Holy Site Amid Suspicion of Orthodox Church Tied to Moscow
description: The security services said they searched for spies and weapons at the Monastery of the Caves in Kyiv. Dozens of priests have been arrested since the war began on charges of aiding Russia.

title: Hebe de Bonafini, 93, Who Rallied Mothers of ‘the Disappeared,’ Dies
description: She was a key force behind a 1970s human rights movement demanding justice from Argentina’s brutal military dictatorship. Her extreme leftist views later made her a polarizing figure.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Indonesia’s Death Toll Climbs
description: Plus Saudi Arabia defeats Argentina, Australia loses to France and lockdowns spread across China.

title: Drone Attack Strikes Sevastopol in Crimea, Kremlin-backed Official Says
description: After a drone attack in October, Russia temporarily suspended its cooperation with a deal that allowed Ukrainian grain safe passage through the Black Sea.

title: UK Starts to Look at Brexit With ‘Bregret’
description: Stung by inflation and bracing for tax increases, the country is in the midst of its gravest slump in a generation, leading many to wonder how much the split with the European Union is to blame.

title: Photos from China’s Latest Covid-19 Lockdowns
description: Empty streets, shuttered shops, long lines at coronavirus testing sites and other scenes from China as it tries to combat rapidly spreading outbreaks in cities across the country.

title: Almost Safe, She Returned to Munich and Lost a Bronzino and Her Life
description: A portrait by Bronzino that Ilse Hesselberger once owned is coming up for sale, a reminder of the brutality, and twists of fate, that Jews confronted in the Nazi era.

title: The War With Russia Has Further Divided Orthodox Churches in Ukraine
description: The leaders of the central branch of the Orthodox church in Ukraine made a formal break with the hierarchy in Moscow in April.

title: To the Moon
description: NASA is on a return mission.

title: Millions of Ukrainians Expected to Be Displaced This Winter
description: As many as three million Ukrainians could leave their homes. The government began evacuations from cities where it says it cannot guarantee basic services.

title: South Africa’s Cyril Ramaphosa Wins a Crucial A.N.C. Battle
description: President Cyril Ramaphosa emerged well-placed to win a second term as the head of the country’s governing party, although there is much haggling and horse-trading to come.

title: In Philippines, Harris Promises Support and Denounces China
description: The vice president accused China of “intimidation and coercion” in disputed waters, as the Biden administration seeks partners to counter Beijing.

title: China’s Grandparents Are Done Babysitting and Ready to Go Viral
description: Rapping grannies, crooning 70-year-olds and gamers in their 80s are challenging traditional Chinese views about aging and what it means to have a long and happy life.

title: The Cool, Wild and Very Remote Andaman Islands
description: This archipelago in the Indian Ocean offers pristine nature, Indian culture, a glimpse of fascinating communities and some of the most spectacular beaches in the world.

title: In Indonesia, an Earthquake, Landslides and Homes ‘Flat to the Earth’
description: As workers try to find survivors, rescue efforts have been hampered by power outages and blocked roads in a disaster that has killed at least 252 people and injured hundreds.

title: China Factory Fire Kills 38
description: Officials say an investigation is underway into what caused the tragedy at the two-story facility operated by a wholesaler of industrial equipment, clothing and chemical products.

title: Beijing Is Tackling Its Air Pollution Problem. Why Can’t New Delhi?
description: The return of smog season in India’s capital has again left residents asking why nothing has changed. The answer may be largely political.

title: Outbreaks Test China’s Efforts to Limit the Cost of ‘Zero Covid’
description: China wants to fine-tune its stringent pandemic restrictions to reduce the disruption to daily life caused by lockdowns. But officials are still taking few chances.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: A devastating earthquake has killed more than 150 people in Indonesia.

title: For Ukraine, So Much Unexpected Success, and Yet So Far to Go
description: Ukraine is on the offensive along most of the 600-mile front line, and the Russians are in a defensive crouch. But about one-fifth of Ukrainian territory is still occupied by Russia.

title: Ukraine Remembers Milestone on Long Path to Putin’s War
description: In hindsight, protests that began nine years ago and toppled a Ukrainian president were a pivot point in efforts by Vladimir V. Putin to exert Russian control over Ukraine.
